21 Gifts for Puzzle Lovers (Who Are Also Into Food) | Bon Appétit

However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.I didn’t think I was a puzzle person. No disrespect to Alex Beggs, but the idea of spending all day toiling away at one of those color gradient abominations made my eyeballs itch. But pre-March 2020 I also didn’t think I was someone who would be “into composting” or “own formal sweatpants." And if the Great Jigsaw Puzzle Shortage of last spring is any indication, I am not alone in my conversion.All this is to say that puzzles gifts have gone from niche—maybe something you got for your indoor kid brother or your aunt who collects Hummel figurines—to a viable gift idea for just about anyone. And food people are no exception. Below you'll find the best gifts for puzzle lovers who are as obsessed with perfecting their pie crust as they are with finding all the corner pieces—and we've paired each with a Bon Appétit recipe, so you can snack while you puzz.For the carb loverBread HeadThis 1000-piecer is harder than mastering enriched dough.
$36 at Bon Appétit MarketSpaghetti WesternFun fact: Chris Morocco wore these very boots while developing his recipe for BA's Best Spaghetti and Meatballs.
$36 at Piecework$36 at Bloomingdales'sIcing on the CakeKind of chic, kind of vintage, very extra. The perfect gift for the extreme baker in your life.
$15 at AmazonI Love DonutsKeep our recipe for lemony glazed cake donuts on hand for when cravings inevitably strike.
$11 at TargetKitchen Smells Puzzle SetThis set comes with three different puzzles—a slice of cherry pie, a cup of coffee, and a wedge of blue cheese—and each is designed to be completed in twenty minutes or less. It’s a little sweet, a little bold, and a little funky.
$45 at Food52For the friend mourning the end of outdoor dining seasonGone Fishin’No almond-crusted trout until you finish.
$32 at Bon Appétit MarketBuns OutFor the summertime grill master and the wintertime puzzle lord.
$36 at Food52$36 at PieceworkEating OutsideThis bright and bold 1000-piece jigsaw puzzle features an al fresco scene by Mexican artist Ana Leovy. Pour yourself a cup of tea and dream of warmer days.
$13 at TargetSunbathers by Rhi JamesSnuggle a snack board next to your puzzle board (what, you let your puzzles take up kitchen table space?) and call it an indoor picnic.
$40 at Surf Shack PuzzlesJuicyMake yourself a Mai Tai and let this vintage-inspired fruit salad scene from Le Puzz transport you to a place where papayas are in season. (Plus, it comes with a reusable bag and a fold-out poster.)
$28 at Le PuzzFor your enemyBanana HandsWelcome to my nightmares! Find me stress-eating caramelized banana pudding.
$32 at Bon Appétit MarketFor the best host in your circleToga PartyMix up some blood orange Jell-o shots and let's see how far you get.
$32 at Bon Appétit MarketOmsomniaA hot pot gathering that doesn’t require any cooking, courtesy of the sisters behind BA favorite Omsom.
$36 at PieceworkBerry Nice Cheese BoardA great gift for puzzle lovers, a great gift for cheese lovers.
$35 at Food52Troublemakers Puzzle + One Stripe Chai Co. Gulab CityFor the person on your gift list who loves puzzles and tea, this set includes a 500-piece puzzle featuring the art of Manuja Waldia and a chai blend made with rose petals, black tea, and green cardamom from One Stripe Chai Co.
$55 at Ordinary HabitFor the food people who are also animal peoplePlenty of FishOne for the kids! A 100-piece sea scene for the youngest puzzle enthusiasts. Pair with pulpo.
$28 at Bon Appétit MarketSloth Eating NoodlesWe recommend pairing this puzzle with ginger scallion ramen noodles—but no shame in boiling some instant Shin Ramyun instead.
$15 $13 at AmazonRetro Dachshund Hot Dog AdIs this...cannibalism?
$30 at EtsyPizza Cat PuzzleNot to be confused with the Pizza Space Cat Puzzle or the Space Cat Pizza Puzzle. The pizza cat puzzle genre is deep, just like this Detroit-style pan pizza.
$20 at ZazzleFor those who appreciate a good drinkJapanese DrinksPour yourself a highball and settle in. Bonus: A portion of the proceeds are donated to The Equal Justice Initiative.
$35 at Etsy99 Bottles of Beer on The WallKnow what goes great with beer? Tacos.
